column1: High rates of community transmission mean that all activities become more dangerous with a higher risk of exposure. Remember that Covid-19 can spread without symptoms. We’re closer than ever to the end of the pandemic but we have to keep each other safe.

Remember: a negative Covid-19 test is not a passport to let down your guard. Symptoms can develop after a negative test and you can be exposed immediately after a negative test. Sacrifices now will pay off: we’re closer than ever to vaccines. Now stay safe and stay home.

Our greatest threats Covid-19 and climate change are global problems that require global solutions. It’s time for Congress to come together to support a new cooperative approach to American global leadership. Rebuild the State department and restore moral leadership.
At-home testing could make a real difference in detecting and stopping the spread of Covid-19. https://t.co/jbxzLD6Fsb

Dr. Fauci is completely correct— uncoordinated local strategies have allowed COVID-19 to spread widely. I was briefed yesterday by Dr. Vivek Murthy the Co-Chair of President-elect Biden’s Coronavirus Task Force. Federal leadership will save lives. https://t.co/oWcPXTrVpR

New Covid restrictions in some CA counties are tough but there’s no question that they are the right move. There is light at the end of the tunnel as we move closer to vaccines—we need to do everything possible to save lives. Cases have doubled in the last 10 days. 1/3

The president’s attempt to discredit the election and sow confusion with baseless fraud allegations hurts our democracy. But he’s also refusing to do any part of his job. COVID cases are spiking and he is completely missing in action. It’s a disaster.
Please exercise caution. COVID-19 cases are spiking ahead of the holiday season. Stay safe. https://t.co/BSFBOzujfB
COVID-19 cases are spiking nationwide. Don’t ignore this threat. We’re entering a dark period which could cause more disruptions to everyday lives. Wear a mask. Stop the spread.

As the president continues to make empty legal threats trying to undermine confidence in the election COVID-19 cases are spiking across our country. He has no plan to respond and continues to obstruct stimulus. It’s up to us—do your part to keep our community safe.

Breaking the previous one-day high the US saw nearly 90000 new COVID cases yesterday. Cases are spiking nationwide. Health officials are pointing to lax public health protocols. Please wear a mask. Practice strict social distancing. Wash your hands. https://t.co/xMiNhOSAbX

You cannot defeat a pandemic if you cannot accept that a pandemic exists. As new cases spiked to record highs the White House on Tuesday listed “ending the COVID-19 pandemic” as Trump's top scientific achievement. You can't wish away the problem. https://t.co/8yqWICUNeY

After pushing through a Supreme Court nominee and breaking all previous norms about the timing of the process the Senate GOP leadership has gone out of session until after the election—without voting on a COVID relief plan that is so desperately needed by so many Americans.

The House passed a $3T COVID relief bill in May. Mitch McConnell has refused to call a vote on it. Since then 6.5M+ Americans have tested positive. Asked about the delay during a debate McConnell bizarrely & repeatedly laughed. Americans are hurting-this is no laughing matter.

Senate GOP leader Mitch McConnell has again rejected a coronavirus relief bill based on what the House and White House are calling for. His obstruction and unwillingness to compromise is hurting Americans who desperately need relief. https://t.co/qXUAeQtB3W

I’m proud of the progress we’ve made to suppress the second wave of Covid infections—but we know that the pandemic is far from over. Don’t let down your guard. Avoid indoor gatherings. Wear a mask. Observe social distancing. Wash your hands. https://t.co/OlNxpD1OPf

The health disparities that Covid-19 has exposed are tragic and immoral. We need to do more to support environmental justice improve access to care in vulnerable communities and guarantee healthcare to all. https://t.co/qz9LeW7g8Y

The Senate GOP has made it clear that they’re unable to pass a Covid relief package. There’s only one option left. They must accept the Heroes Act now—to guarantee sweeping economic relief for the American people and for our communities.

The Republicans are struggling to pull together even an inadequate COVID relief package but our communities can’t wait. We need to fully renew expanded UI aid cities and states guarantee a safe election and protect families & essential workers. We must pass the #HeroesAct

I pray that we have a vaccine against Covid-19 ready for deployment as soon as possible. However the timing of this order raises serious concerns about political influence on the CDC. We cannot allow political interference in medicine. 1/2 https://t.co/2KAGix8WSc

We’ve passed 6 million confirmed COVID-19 cases. We still don’t have a comprehensive national strategy to contain and defeat the disease. It’s not too late- pass the Heroes Act and provide a national testing strategy now!

Our communities have made impressive progress in suppressing the latest wave of Covid-19 but we can’t let down our guard. We know what needs to be done. Wear a mask. Avoid gathering indoors. Stay safe stay distanced. We’re all in this together.

The fundamental underpinning of democracy is the right to vote while we are under the COVID pandemic vote by mail is the safest way to vote. Not for one single party – but for the nation. More than undemocratic Trump’s actions the authoritarian steps of a dictator.

COVID-19 isn’t the only crisis we need to come together to face. Climate change remains an existential long term threat. We can’t ignore the need to cut emissions and rebuild a sustainable economy. https://t.co/xTUWSYlJvJ

Our nation has passed a tragic threshold with over 150000 deaths due to the COVID pandemic. Join me in grieving for each one of these people- they were our family members and friends our neighbors our coworkers. We must never become numb to the scale of this tragedy.

Wear a mask. Maintain 6-foot social distancing whenever possible. Remember that airborne droplets spread more easily indoors and stay home as much as possible. We all need to do our part to stay safe and reverse the spread of COVID-19.

The president has failed to develop any kind of federal testing strategy. He cares more about optics than the Americans who are at risk of COVID-19.   Testing is vital to protecting the public identifying and containing the spread of the disease.

This study found that if 80% of Americans wore masks death and infection rates from COVID-19 would plummet. Masks protect people from hazardous droplets which spread the disease. They make it safer to reopen society. Wear one: its common sense. https://t.co/ElCWjv8Img

The evidence is clear: masks are critical to reducing the spread of COVID-19. Masks allow us to safely resume more and more normal activities. This can’t be about politics; this is about public health. Please be responsible when out in public for yourself and your community.

Rising COVID-19 outbreaks in states across our country are deeply concerning. The administration has given up on a national strategy and continues to fail to provide real leadership. COVID-19 is still a serious threat. https://t.co/5MSdUlLTX0

Long Beach has seen it’s 100th death from Covid-19. Make no mistake the threat posed by the virus is still very real. Do everything you can to practice social distancing. Wear a mask. Wash your hands. https://t.co/DhPeXySGEO
Remember: the threat of COVID-19 is still very real. Do everything you can to safely practice social distancing. Wear a mask. Wash your hands. Stay six feet from others as much as possible.

The World Health Organization did not respond perfectly to COVID-19—but international cooperation in the face of a shared crisis is vital. This is no time for irresponsible bickering. https://t.co/VnSV4kt2Z6

The USPS is a vital service. We can’t allow its mission to be disrupted by coronavirus—but it needs assistance to meet rising costs and declining revenue now. I’m fighting to make sure it gets the resources it needs as soon as possible.

Nationalism is undermining the global response to the coronavirus. The virus doesn’t see borders—yet the Administration continues to counterproductively withhold aid from vulnerable populations. Check out my op ed with @RepRashida https://t.co/X13gF9sX34

Our nationwide COVID testing capacity remains dangerously inadequate. We conduct fewer tests per capita than many other advanced countries. We have no national strategy to quickly and rapidly distribute more tests and supplies. This is dangerous. The administration must act.

We’re learning more about COVID-19 every day. Science will save us—but our policy responses must adapt to new facts. The CDC has updated it’s list of symptoms associated with the disease. Stay safe!  https://t.co/umVOhHw0qj
ICYM: Yesterday I joined my @NRDems colleagues for a #EnviroJusticeNow roundtable on Coronavirus aggravating economic and environmental disparities. Watch here: https://t.co/odINso83pl

The ability to test and trace the coronavirus will allow us to contain the spread of disease and reopen our economy more quickly and safely. Proud of California’s leadership—but we need a national strategy! https://t.co/DfIx7Brxkg

The CDC has expanded the list of symptoms associated with COVID-19.  •Fever •Cough •Shortness of breath •Chills •Repeated shaking with chills •Muscle pain •Headache •Sore throat •New loss of taste or smell Learn more at https://t.co/umVOhHNBOT
For updated information on the federal response to the COVID-19 crisis and to learn about available resources keep monitoring our website: https://t.co/KCPDG9bOna

Xenophobia won’t save us. Immigrants aren’t to blame for coronavirus. It’s dangerous to try to implement sweeping policies in late-night tweets. And this is an affront to the immigrant healthcare providers on the front lines of this crisis. https://t.co/3WC9YKu8Gi

🚨DEADLINE ALERT🚨 - Social Security recipients with children under 17 need to claim dependents with the IRS before tomorrow April 22 at 9:00 AM PST if they want to receive the full amount of their #coronavirus rebate.  https://t.co/ALDoscsCxs
LA County residents can now receive free same-day testing if they are experiencing #COVID19 symptoms. If you are experiencing fever cough or difficulty breathing sign up at: https://t.co/w6YVnZTVaF
Check out our updated coronavirus information site where information on resources for workers employers students and CARES act resources are available: https://t.co/KCPDG8UdvC

Conditions in Gaza will lead to an unprecedented humanitarian catastrophe if COVID-19 is able to spread. The US continues to withhold critical aid. We have a moral and strategic responsibility to end our disastrous policy and work to prevent an outbreak. https://t.co/OZkjvpeZHe

ATTENTION: The IRS has created online tools to help ensure Americans receive their Coronavirus Economic Impact Payments. If you have filed taxes and are wondering when you'll receive your payment you can track it here: https://t.co/njWVqEWf4Q

Do you need health coverage due to the #coronavirus? Due to the #COVID19 crisis you can enroll now in a health plan through Covered California and may be eligible to receive financial help to reduce what you pay for coverage. Get started here: https://t.co/7cR5vzsgSp

The US Postal Service is a critical resource. Its dedicated employees are doing their duty under extremely difficult conditions. We cannot allow it to collapse because of the financial impact of coronavirus. #SavethePostOffice 📬

We need to recognize that poor underserved and minority populations have faced disproportionate rates of infection and tragically higher death rates from Covid 19. We need to recognize address and respond to these structural inequalities.

This critical research is a reminder of why we need to fight every day to protect clean air. Pollution claims countless lives all over the world every year causes serious illness for others and increases the danger posed by COVID-19. https://t.co/UcbxyTSkG7
As we confront the Coronavirus we need to balance the needs of others in our healthcare system. Proud to support this effort. https://t.co/NBBAxX8Gen

Today we mark the first day of National Public Health Week. The public health professionals on the front lines of our fight against the coronavirus have never been more critical. We must do everything we can to support their efforts.

Vulnerable people in ICE custody are in danger. Detention facilities make social distancing and basic precautions impossible. I’m proud to lead 34 of my colleagues to call for the immediate release of anyone at high medical risk of Covid 19. https://t.co/HpoWKtuAMF

Social distancing is paying off. We can defeat coronavirus if we all do our part. Congress must continue to do its part too. We must continue to provide all the resources our country and our economy need for as long as it takes.

Don't lose hope: other countries have contained coronavirus outbreaks with social distancing and most importantly very aggressive testing programs. Democracies like South Korea are among the most successful. This isn’t over—but we must learn from them! https://t.co/9SC5q0aUNy

The State Department has created a 24-hour public hotline for Americans abroad who are impacted by the COVID-19 crisis. For callers in the U.S. and Canada the number is 888-407-4747. For those dialing from overseas the number is 202-501-4444.

Social distancing is vital to fight the spread of coronavirus but we need to recognize that it has serious costs for our economy and for our emotional wellbeing. We need strong support for mental health in our emergency response bill and we must care for one another.

Be advised: VA medical facilities have paused elective procedures to ensure the safety of all patience and guarantee sufficient resources for our fight against coronavirus. For more information about VA resources see: https://t.co/gy8nTbWvXy.

Last week’s coronavirus relief package includes $1 billion in emergency grants to strengthen our social safety net for unemployed workers. More relief is needed and more will come but we are taking aggressive action.

It’s essential that we slow the spread of coronavirus with aggressive social distancing and we all have a role to play. The administration must use this time to ramp up our testing infrastructure boost hospital capacity and prepare for the next phase of this battle.
LBUSD will provide meals to children during the coronavirus school closure period.  Free breakfast and lunch to children at LBUSD school locations. See more: https://t.co/OQegYVMAsM

My staff will be working remotely for the near future as we do our part to contain the spread of the coronavirus. We are still available to assist you: call us at 202-225-7924 (DC) 562-436-3828 (Long Beach) 714-243-4088 (Garden Grove) or contact us at https://t.co/qdwOLKXAnq.

The economic impacts of the disruption will be significant but Congress will do everything it can to respond. We passed bipartisan legislation to ensure sick leave and free coronavirus testing strengthen Medicaid unemployment insurance and SNAP. 2/2

I applaud @CAgovernor for taking these bold measures. Containing the spread of coronavirus will require difficult sacrifices and inconveniences for all of us. It’s essential that we take this seriously and work to protect the most vulnerable among us. https://t.co/ouBBe1fUrD 1/2

If you have any #COVID19 symptoms stay home. I voted to ensure all Americans have paid leave if they are sick or caring for a loved one. Get the facts about coronavirus symptoms here: https://t.co/V0bcy1lt7x
#FamiliesFirst ensures all Americans can afford testing for #COVID19 including the uninsured. In a public health crisis we cannot leave anyone behind.

Proud of @HouseDemocrats for putting #FamiliesFirst in our coronavirus response. Families need paid leave food assistance and access to free testing for #COVID19. I call on the Senate to pass our legislation immediately. The American people need our support.

To protect the public from potential exposure to coronavirus the U.S. Capitol will be closed to tours through the end of March. If you have questions please do not hesitate to call my office at (202) 225-7924

I am encouraged to see President Trump beginning to taking the coronavirus more seriously after weeks of downplaying the severity of the outbreak. However we know that the disease is spreading domestically while insufficient testing is weakening our response.  1/2

Any economic response to the coronavirus must put working families first. Before we bail out wealthy corporations we need to ensure free & widespread testing sick leave and support for workers who lose hours or pay.

Proud of Congress’s robust bipartisan coronavirus aid package which provided far more than the administration’s requests. State & local agencies need our full support and we will invest in vital research into vaccines & treatment. https://t.co/h3HVeolpXD

Deeply alarmed to see the impact of supply chain disruptions due to coronavirus on our community. I stand with our working people & will do everything possible to support them through this crisis.  https://t.co/fG6ApDDhDP

.@HouseDemocrats’ #Covid19 supplemental will provide billions for treatment research and for public health programs to contain & fight the spread of coronavirus. We will also devote millions to ensure that Americans have access to vaccines. 1/3

President Trump keeps trying to downplay the coronavirus—this is deeply irresponsible. The administration’s response has been marred by confusion inadequate testing and politicized efforts to downplay the crisis. We need to listen to scientists. https://t.co/NxauPJqpTf

Glad to see that LA County is taking strong steps to make sure we can combat coronavirus—remember the best way to protect yourself is to take commonsense precautions. You can find more resources and local information here: https://t.co/518rLbLJOv
Remember to continue to monitor the latest information and advice from @CDCgov: https://t.co/ZQa70CHTq3 Commonsense precautions are the best defense.  #COVID19

Common-sense precautions can help reduce the risk of coronavirus for everyone. Wash your hands often and thoroughly. Disinfect household objects. Stay home if you are sick. See more at: https://t.co/iA1oPeyd4x

.@HouseDemocrats will do everything possible to make sure at we are prepared to fight coronavirus. We need to make sure that the administration takes the threat seriously and that political concerns don’t interfere with their response. We all have a role to play. https://t.co/1FQ3vUvpCL

Yesterday in congressional testimony Secretary Azar refused to ensure that everyone would have access to a potential coronavirus vaccine. This is an indictment of the inequality in our healthcare system. https://t.co/IQnfUY7i50  1/2

We need a calm rational and measured response to coronavirus—which ensures that local communities have the resources needed to prepare and respond. I’m increasingly concerned that the administration is placing political concerns ahead of public health. https://t.co/3rVjSlpcsz

We need to take the threat posed by coronavirus seriously and make the necessary investments immediately. Meanwhile and inexplicably the president’s budget actually proposes cuts to the CDC. https://t.co/uc8USaW4oR
